2. Start with the multiples of zero and one

Adding zero to a number has no effect on its identity:
\nâžœ n + 0 = n
\nin multiplication, any number multiplied by zero is also zero:
\nâžœ n x 0 = 0
\n0 is a void!
\n
\nMultiplying by one (The identity property):
\nIn short, the identity property states that the product of a given number and one is that number itself:
\nâžœ n x 1 = n
\n
\nMultiplying a number by one results in the same value. Let\'s say, one x 10 apples results to 10 apples. 1 is a mirror!

Just like addition, multiplication is commutative, meaning the order of factors doesn\'t change the product (the answer).
\n
\nIn other words, two numbers can be multiplied in any order, and the product will be the same. For example, multiplying 8 x 2 will give you the same answer as multiplying 2 x 8.

The rule of associative property states that no matter the way you group factors, the product will always be the same.
\n
\nFor example,
\nâžœ (a x b) x c = a x (b x c)
\nor
\nâžœ (1 x 2) x 3 = 1 x (2 x 3)

The distributive property is symbolized as:
\nâžœ a(b + c) = (ab) + (ac)
\n
\nPut simply, the property spreads out â€” or, as its name implies, distributes â€” the value of a equally to b and c.
\n
\nFor example,
\nfor 6 x 8, they may use the distributive property to think:
\nâžœ (6 x 5) + (6 x 3), or 30 + 18

\n1.1 Push the button "LEARN".

\n3. How can I see my profile details?
\n3.1 You can see your profile details by pressing the button with the human figure from the main menu.
\n4. How can I edit my name?
\n4.1 You can edit your name by pressing the button with the human figure from the main menu.

\n4.3 Write the name you want in the brackets and click the button "SAVE".

\n5.1 You can log out from the profile page by pressing the button with the human figure from the main menu and then press the button "LOGOUT".
